speaker: Martin
text: Don't walk away from me when I'm yellin' at you!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll walk away from you if I want to!  It's my house!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, don't I know it!  You have no respect for my stuff!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well if you had labeled the cassette "Rodeo Bloopers", I wouldn't have taped over it, I would have thrown it away! _Frasier storms out the front door.  Martin sits in his chair and starts to read a paper.  Frasier comes back in, contrite._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Forget it, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's just that I've been so tense lately, being out of work.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, I know.  It's not easy, us both being home so much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, well I suppose that during this little in-between-jobs period, we should just try to be extra careful not to get on each other's nerves.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, I'll do that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good. [_He notices something on the table by the door._] Dad, what's this?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, a call came in for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Rebecca Wendell!  Oh my God!

speaker: Martin
text: Isn't she that model you've been after?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not just a model, Dad, a lingerie model!  I met her at the symphony.  Wow, this is amazing!  When did this come in?

speaker: Martin
text: About an hour ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was here an hour ago.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you were in the tub.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_going to the phone_] That didn't stop you yesterday when you came in to ask me if a peach smelled funny!  For God's sake, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: I'd like to know how this is my fault!  I put it right there in the special message bowl that we're all supposed to use.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, it's her machine.  Well, thanks a lot, Dad!  I've been looking forward to this for months!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, now you know how I feel about the rodeo tape.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, the two things have no comparison whatsoever...! [_charmingly into the phone_] Hello, Rebecca, it's Frasier.  Sorry I missed you.  Please try again.  Uh, bye. [_He hangs up._] Well, I hope you're happy!  Now I have to sit here all afternoon waiting for the phone to ring!

speaker: Martin
text: As opposed to what you normally do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's rich coming from you!  A man who's spent the last five years welded to his aptly named Lay-Z-Boy!

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] Well, I'm not so lazy that I can't get the hell out of here!

speaker: Frasier
text: I haven't finished talking to you, yet!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I've finished listening!

speaker: Frasier
text: As usual, running away from the problem!

speaker: Martin
text: Not the problem, the yammering!  You want to tape over somethin'?  Try your mouth! _He slams the door on his way out.  Frasier stands there, furious.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Cafe Nervosa FADE IN.  Martin is sitting at a table by the counter, Roz comes in._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Decaf latte to go, please.  So, is Frasier here?

speaker: Martin
text: I hope not.

speaker: Roz
text: Uh-oh.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's just been such a pill lately.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you know, it's tough for people when they're out of work.  They just get a little tense and irritable. [_The waitress brings Roz a coffee cup._] To go!  I said to go! [_To Martin_] So why don't you two take a little break from each other?  Have you ever thought about, I don't know, staying with Niles for a while?

speaker: Martin
text: Out of the frying pan into the fire, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, think about it.  Niles's place is so huge, and he's at work all the time.

speaker: Martin
text: That's true.  And Maris is out of the picture now.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I just thought of something: for a while there, your daughters-in-law were Maris and Lilith. [_Martin laughs_] Whoa, Happy Thanksgiving!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not interrupting anything personal, am I?

speaker: Roz
text: [_taking Martin's hand_] Yeah, Niles, we just eloped. I'm your new mom. [_Martin smiles and pats her hand._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'll be a son of a bitch.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waitress_] Latte, please.

speaker: Roz
text: So Martin, why don't you tell Niles your new idea?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, actually, it was Roz's idea, but I think she might have something, you know?  You know, Frasier and I have been kinda buttin' heads lately...

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Frasier has been very difficult.  I don't know how you live with him.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that was Roz's idea.  She suggested that I move in with you for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: [_dumbstruck_] Did she?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  You know, we talked about it when I first got shot, but of course Maris was the problem.  So I guess the big question now is: do you still want me?

speaker: Niles
text: [_a fake smile pasted on_] Oh, don't be silly.  I want you just as much now as I wanted you then.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess this is gonna work out.  Thanks, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't mention it.  The look on Niles's face is thanks enough.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, Dad, you're sure it won't bother you to live so far from the park and McGinty's?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no, not at all.  There's a bus stop right in front of your place.  Eddie and I don't mind takin' the bus.

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizing_] Eddie?  Eddie.  You know, I just remembered, Dad, my building doesn't allow dogs.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well that's it, then.  'Cause I'm not leavin' Eddie.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of all the horrendous luck.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, thanks anyway.  I guess I'll just look for a little place.  Can't be too small, though, 'cause I gotta have a bedroom for Daphne. _He starts thinking.  Niles is pouring cream in his coffee and freezes in thought himself.  We can see it takes careful concentration for him not to spill any._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Dad.  About that no dog rule: I could talk to Clarice, the head of our co-op board.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, really?  You think they'd make an exception?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, let's just say she's bent quite a few rules in her day, and if she doesn't want her husband to find out, she'll bend this one.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, then it's settled.  Daphne can move in straight away. [_Martin looks expectant._] YOU and Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Great! _They both smile.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment Frasier is getting some sherry.  Niles and Martin come in the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, where's Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think at the market.  Hello, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, Frasier, about this afternoon...

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, let's just drop it, all right?  All's well that end's well, and this afternoon ended very well indeed.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, your underwear model called?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm.  Just after you left, actually.  We spoke for about an hour, and we're having dinner on Saturday night.

speaker: Martin
text: [_hanging up his coat_] Well, that's great!  I hope everything works out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, Dad, on that score, uh, you could make yourself scarce that night.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, actually, I'm movin' in with Niles for a couple of months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, have some confidence in me, Dad, it won't take me that long.

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, no, no, no.  I mean it.  Niles and I have been talking about it.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  And I think it's a fine idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I know I've been out of sorts lately, Dad, but I hope I haven't made you feel unwelcome...

speaker: Martin
text: No, no.  It's nothin' like that.  Listen, I've been livin' under your roof for five years now, you've earned a little time to yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still, maybe you should sleep on it for tonight...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, please.  You've had a chance to get closer to Dad these past few years and I wouldn't mind having that same chance myself.  Frankly, I'm a bit jealous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I am sorry, Niles.  I guess I haven't been seeing this from your angle.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: And quite a little angle it is, too.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daph, let me ask you somethin'.  How would you feel about movin' in with Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just me?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes. [_recovering_] No, no.  And Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Just 'til Frasier goes back to work.  It's been a little crowded around here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I won't argue with that.  You know, Dr. Crane has quite a few stairs, are you sure you can manage them?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sitting_] Oh, sure.  Nobody knows better than you how my well my hip's gettin'.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the bag from her_] Well, what are we waiting for? Let's get you packed.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wait a minute. [_Niles stops and turns._] I was hired as Mr. Crane's physical therapist.  If he can make it up and down that staircase of yours, he really doesn't need full time care anymore.  This is hard for me to say, but maybe it's time I moved on.

speaker: Daphne
text: We all knew this day would come sooner or later.

speaker: Martin
text: What about my exercises?

speaker: Daphne
text: You'll do fine on your own.  Believe me, it's not like I want to move on, I'm very fond of you all.  I'm not like a psychiatrist, who works with someone for years and years and it doesn't matter if they ever get better. [_Martin nods in understanding, Frasier and Niles share a look._] My work here is done.  I have to go where I'm needed. _All the others start talking.  "We need you."  "Dad needs you." "You're needed."_

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not like I'm leaving right this minute.  I'll help you get settled in while I look for a new job.

speaker: Niles
text: But Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, please, don't make a big fuss about this.  You'll just make me cry.  This is no time for tears.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess you know what's best.  It's sure gonna be lonely, though, just the two of us.

speaker: Daphne
text: It won't just be the two of you, you'll have Eddie. _As she exits, Eddie jumps on Niles's lap.  He breaks down crying. Fade out.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - Niles's Apartment FADE IN.  Martin is reading on the couch.  Niles comes in from the kitchen and notices that Eddie is on the dining table, walking around and around the centerpiece._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: [_not looking_] Eddie, whatever you're on, get off. _Eddie jumps off the table.  Niles returns to the kitchen.  Reset to: the kitchen.  Daphne is on the phone._

speaker: Daphne
text: I've been on hold with my employment agency forever. [_into phone_] Yes, I'm here.  Nothing at all, not even part-time therapy?  Well, I'll stay in touch.  Bye-bye.

speaker: Niles
text: So, no job yet, eh?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, unfortunately.  Still, tragedies happen every day. I mustn't give up hope.

speaker: Niles
text: I wish you'd consider staying here with us.  I don't know how Dad's going to manage without you.

speaker: Daphne
text: He doesn't need me anymore.

speaker: Niles
text: Nonsense.  I know he puts on a brave front, the plain truth is, the man is practically an invalid.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, come back here!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] What's he got now?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, my sneaker.  You give me that back or I'm not taking you for your speed walk!  He chases Eddie back to the living room.  The doorbell rings.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.  Hi, Niles.  Forgive me, I know how annoying it can be to drop by without calling first.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't worry, I used to do it all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's how I know.  Hello, Eddie.  Got a little surprise for you, something you left at the house.  There you are. _He gives Eddie a squeak toy.  Eddie grabs it and begins causing it to squeak loudly and rapidly.  Niles, trying to trim a plant, jerks violently.  The doorbell rings again and Frasier opens both sides of the double doors._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, Niles, you'll get used to it.  Oh, and Dad, I've got a little surprise for you as well.  Just a minute. All right, boys, bring it on in here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great, here it is!  Now the place is starting to look like home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and finally so is mine!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm just gonna go finish unpacking.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you just follow him up with that.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no, leave it right there.  That way I won't get my pizza cheese all over your fancy chairs.

speaker: Niles
text: Doesn't the cheese go in your mouth?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's certainly the goal, Niles, but you can't hit that bulls eye every time.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, this isn't working out, you have to take him back now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, he's only been here for eight hours.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't care.  I only signed on for this because Daphne came in the bargain and now she's leaving and Frasier, you have to help me, I'm desperate!

speaker: Martin
text: [_calling from upstairs_] Niles, which wall should I hang my swordfish on?

speaker: Niles
text: [_horrified_] None of them!  I just had that room frescoed! _He rushes up the stairs.  Frasier goes into the kitchen.  Reset to: Kitchen.  Daphne is again on the phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daph...

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks, Ronny, you're a life saver.  Bye-bye. [_She hangs up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good news on the job front?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, a friend of mine just got me an interview.  It's an elderly woman suffering from brittle bone disease, poor thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, normally I'd say "Break a leg", but...

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm gonna miss you.  All of you. [_They hug._] But like I told your brother, there's simply no reason for me to stay as long as your father's so strong and healthy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God. _He and Daphne rush to the living room.  Reset to: the living room.  Martin is lying at the bottom of the stairs. Frasier and Daphne rush to help him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!  Dad!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, are you all right?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.

speaker: Martin
text: We just got tangled up there.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I am so sorry!

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry about it, it was an accident.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you do seem to be in one piece.  Still, it was an awfully big fall.  Dr. Crane, would you help me get some ice?

speaker: Niles
text: Good thinking, Daphne.  I know I could use a drink.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that was so weird.  Niles just kicked my cane right out from under me.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I know he wants to keep Daphne around here, but I didn't think he'd go that far. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, not deliberately, but maybe he was acting on an unconscious level.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?  I was just making a joke.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, then just-just skip it, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, wait a minute.  You think Niles was actually trying to hurt me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  It's just that... well, sometimes, when the motivation is strong enough, the unconscious can cause a person to act in ways that the conscious would find unthinkable.

speaker: Martin
text: So you're saying that this wasn't an accident.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Ah, it's a crazy theory.  I'm sorry I even brought it up. You know what?  I, uh, I think I'll be off now.  Off to my bachelor pad, I have a date with a lingerie model.  Ha, ha, ha... "bachelor pad, lingerie model" - the sweetest words in the English language.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry I won't be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait.  We have a tie!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier. [_He closes the door after him._]

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, Mr. Crane, I need you to take a seat so I can ice your hip.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm fine.  Why is everyone making such a fuss?

speaker: Daphne
text: Wait, don't sit down!

speaker: Martin
text: [_jumping up_] What?!

speaker: Daphne
text: You nearly impaled yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank you Daphne.  I don't know what it is about these things, they keep ending up in the oddest places. _He takes the clippers and heads for the kitchen.  She helps Martin sit again, putting the ice pack on his hip.  He has a VERY nervous look on his face.  FADE TO:_ **HOME ALONE** _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment Frasier comes in the front.  He looks around his apartment, sans Martin's chair, and smiles, clutching the bottle of wine he's holding to his chest. He walks to the dining table, running his hand along HIS chair (the Wassily) on the way, and sets the wine down.  He presses the button on his answering machine._

speaker: Rebecca
text: [_v.o. from the machine_] Hi, Frasier, it's Rebecca.  Your voice sounds so sexy on your machine.  Anyway, I loved talking to you this afternoon and I was thinking: instead of going to a noisy restaurant, maybe we can just stay in tonight.  Open some wine, curl up in front of a fire.  Just a warning though, I'm coming straight from a shoot, so I'll be wearing my work clothes. [_She giggles._] I can't believe I just said that. _Throughout this, Frasier has been grinning and smiling at each new bit.  When it is done, he pours himself a sherry, then takes it and the answering machine to the small table by his chair.  He sits, picks up his sherry and hits the button again._

speaker: Rebecca
text: Hi, Frasier, it's Rebecca.  Your voice sounds so sexy on your machine.  Anyway, I loved talking to you... _Frasier smiles and sips his sherry.  FADE TO:_ **DIAL M FOR MARTIN** _Scene Three - Niles's Apartment Niles is in the spare bathroom, washing his hands.  Martin comes in._

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, the floors around here are so slippery!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I, I just had them polished.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wish you would have told me, Eddie just slid into a wall and chipped a tooth.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Dad, I can assure you there will be no slipping in here. [_Gesturing to the bath._] Look: a brand new safety rail installed just for you.  And, as requested, traction decals!

speaker: Martin
text: [_leaning over the tub_] Oh, I don't need to worry about falling in... [_The rail collapses under the pressure of his hand._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Dad, are you OK?

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, yeah.  It's a good thing I wasn't in the shower, I could have cracked my head open.

speaker: Niles
text: Guess I'm not much of a handyman, am I?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking nervous_] You put this thing up yourself?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, my contractor was out of town.  Don't worry, you can use my bathroom to shower.  Just let me know when you do. The plumbing's a bit temperamental and if I were to run the dishwasher, you might be horribly scalded.

speaker: Martin
text: [_following_] You know?  I took an extra long shower yesterday, you know?  That oughta hold me. _CUT TO: the living room.  Niles is coming down from the landing with Martin behind him.  Niles turns back._

speaker: Niles
text: You sure you don't need a hand?

speaker: Martin
text: Just keep movin'.

speaker: Daphne
text: Guess what?  I got the job!  I can't believe it!  I start in the morning.

speaker: Niles
text: You what?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll tell you all about it later.  I've got to call my employment agency right away. _She hurries upstairs.  Niles turns back to Martin, a look of mixed nervousness, desperation and cunning on his face._

speaker: Niles
text: I can't let her leave.  I just can't.

speaker: Martin
text: [_nervous_] Well, there's nothin' we can do about it.

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming down the stairs, his look becoming more cunning_] I still have a day.  I just have to be more resourceful.

speaker: Martin
text: [_fear on his face_] Like how? [_stumbles back against a pillar_]

speaker: Niles
text: It's my problem, not yours.  I just have to think.  Fresh air, maybe that'll calm me down.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at the sunset!  Dad, come join me on the balcony.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie!  Get outta here!  Quick!  Come on, come on, come on! _He and Eddie rush out.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Fade in.  Frasier has set the apartment up for his date and is just pouring the wine.  The doorbell rings and he goes to it, using a remote to start romantic music on the stereo.  He makes some suave moves as he gets into "date mode."  Opening the door, he finds Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Good lord, what are you doing here? [_He uses the remote to shut off the stereo._]

speaker: Martin
text: We gotta talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now?  It's not a good time.

speaker: Martin
text: But it's getting spooky over at Niles's.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, yes, I know it's a little unsettling the way he changes into that Chinese dressing gown after dinner, but you'll get used to it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no.  I think his unconscious is trying to hurt me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, that's preposterous.

speaker: Martin
text: No it isn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't we talk about this in the morning?  Believe me, there is no way your own flesh and blood would try to hurt you. _He closes the door, hitting Martin in the face.  He opens it back up to check on him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Well at least let me get Eddie's pillow out of my room, will you?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, just hurry it up, will ya? _Martin goes back to his room as Frasier closes the door.  The doorbell rings and Frasier again starts the music and gets into "date mode." He opens the door to reveal Daphne._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne! [_He shuts the music off._] What is going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: I hope I'm not catching you at a bad time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, I'm waiting for a date!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll just run in and out, I need to pick up my... [_she starts crying_]...exercise mat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good lord.  Is everything all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry.  I think I'm just a bit nervous about my new job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll be all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just wish, I just wish I didn't miss being here so much. [_She starts crying again._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, oh, I'm sorry.  Listen, you're going to be just fine.  You know, transitions are always difficult. [_The doorbell rings and he shoves her towards her room._] The trick is just not to rush them. _Again he starts the music and goes into his routine.  Opening the door, he finds Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles! [_He shuts the music off._] What the hell are you doing here?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm going out of my mind.  I am this close to living under the same roof as Daphne.  If I could just...

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Niles, before you go on, let me just say one thing.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait!  I need to talk about this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out!  Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming from his room_] Is that Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!  Dad, why did you run off?  I've been looking for you everywhere.

speaker: Martin
text: No, Niles, just stay away from me.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Now, Niles, I'm not mad at you, just your unconscious.  It wants Daphne to stay around so bad that it's been tryin' to hurt me.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Frasier can explain it better.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly who is hurting whom and what does any of this have to do with... [_seeing her as she comes in_] Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look.  We're all together again, just like... [_crying again_] old times.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rushing to hold her_] Oh, dear.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.  Well, we certainly do have a lot to talk about. I tell you what: let's all meet at Niles's for breakfast tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not gettin' in the elevator with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right Dad, Daphne, go in shifts then.  You first.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: So long.  Eddie, you too, shake a leg mister.  Let's go, outta here, move it, move it, move it. [_Eddie scurries out and Frasier closes the door behind him._]

speaker: Niles
text: You actually convinced Dad I was trying to harm him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, I did no such thing.  I simply advanced a theory, I had no idea he would take it to heart.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, balderdash!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Niles, surely it's occurred to you that your desire for Daphne's forcing you to behave in very strange ways. Or do you shove Dad down the stairs every day?

speaker: Niles
text: That was an accident!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, any psychiatrist worth his salt knows that there are no accidents.  No one would do something like that, however unconsciously, unless they stood to gain from it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear! _He and Niles hurry out.  Reset to: the hallway following them. Martin is on his back on the floor, Daphne hovering over him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank God! [_realizing_] ...we're here to help!

speaker: Martin
text: What did you kick my cane for?

speaker: Daphne
text: It was an accident!  I was playing with Eddie!

speaker: Martin
text: My hip's killing me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, don't worry about it.  Niles has that nice comfy bed you can recuperate in.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't go up and down those stairs now!

speaker: Niles
text: I think the best thing would be for him to stay with you again for the time being.

speaker: Daphne
text: He'll need full time attention, I'll cancel my job right away.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just hold it!  Nobody's canceling anything! For God's sake, the man just fell down a flight of stairs today, he could hardly have been hurt worse stumbling in a carpeted hallway! _The elevator opens with Rebecca inside.  Frasier reaches down and tries to pull Martin to his feet._

speaker: Frasier
text: Get up, ya big crybaby!  No pain, no gain.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, but it hurts!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, boo-hoo!  I want you out of here!  I don't care if you have to crawl like a bog turtle!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Rebecca. [_He grabs the remote and turns on the stereo._] I didn't see you standing there.  Why don't you just step on over my father, help yourself to some wine?

speaker: Rebecca
text: What kind of a heartless bastard are you?! [_pushes the button_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, Rebecca, you don't understand.  It's not the way it looks.  He's very resilient!  He's been shot before!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, we really should get him inside.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_a crushed look on his face_] Yes.  Just give me... a moment. _He goes into his apartment, wandering around, absorbing the last moments of his "bachelor pad."  He gets a glass of wine, sits in his chair and takes a sip, a look of total sorrow on his face._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, bring him in. _Niles and Daphne bring Martin in.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
